sections.TOP:
Cockleswhent070967b6ke2prw3d0ssi6k87tl48g7sexa491200572014-03-28T14:30:32ZGreater good3347453/* See also */[[Image:Cockleswhent.png|thumb|right|200px|A map showing the location of the Cockleswhent on the continent of Westeros.]]
The '''Cockleswhent''' is a river in [[the Reach]], the region of [[Westeros]] under the control of [[House Tyrell]] of [[Highgarden]]. It is a tributary of the [[Mander]]. It flows west from headlands near the border with [[the Stormlands]] into the Mander near [[Cider Hall]]. It runs past [[Ashford]].<ref>[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season1/#!/locations/highgarden/ HBO viewers guide, season 1 map, Highgarden entry]</ref>
sections.In the books: In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, the river is spelt "Cockleswent". Whether the HBO version is a misspelling or a deliberate change of spelling is unknown.
